comments.body: @mdoucet @rozyczko @stuartcampbell Are you all happy to be listed as maintainers of this recipe?

@CJ-Wright @chrisburr @mrakitin 
SasView 5.0 is in pre-release (early beta) stage at this point. Not really ready for proper conda-forge release. It would be better to put SasView 4.2.1 (based on python 2.7 and wx-Python) instead, at least until 5.0 is out as a full release.

Sounds good. Regarding the release version, I have no issue creating a recipe for 5.0 if it's properly documented as a beta, but I think we should definitely create a recipe for 4.2.1, which is the latest official release.
Agreed with @mdoucet. If the recipe is documented as a beta, I have no problems with it, given we also have 4.2.1 as official.

@rozyczko, @mdoucet, thanks for the information. The motivation for this PR was that @stuartcampbell had a conversation with your team and mentioned you were enthusiastic about having the package at conda-forge. We currently have it in our conda channel (https://anaconda.org/lightsource2-tag/sasview), and as you can see there, the name clearly states it's beta: `v5.0_beta.2_8_g390494d7c`. I'm fine with postponing making changes to this PR until the stable version is released.

Regarding the 4.2.1 recipe, I am not sure I can help here as Python 2.7 will die soon, and our facility is 3.6+ only.

If it should support Windows you need to add a `bld.bat` file else you need to explicitly skip it:
```suggestion
  number: 0
  skip: True  # [win]
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +17,21 @@
build:
  number: 0
  skip: True  # [win or py2k]
  entry_points:

comments.body:
It looks like this has [entry_points](https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda-build/en/latest/source/resources/define-metadata.html#python-entry-points):
```suggestion
  skip: True  # [win or py2k]
  entry_points:
    - sasview = sas.qtgui.MainWindow.MainWindow:run_sasview
```
Yes, it has. What's the advantage of defining the entry points in the recipe while they already exist in the `setup.py` file?

Conda isn't aware of the entry points defined inside the `setup.py` file so this information has to be duplicated.

For a `noarch: python` package this information allows it to be built on one platform (i.e. Linux) and then installed on another (i.e. Windows) with the correct wrapper scripts around these entry points. This doesn't apply here but I'm not sure if there are any other uses that are applicable so it's safer to include it.

OK, let's try this, though after the installation the `sasview` executable/entry point is available, otherwise the [test command](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/7839/files#diff-c1893145bb30029f6fcf9e51475b6826R54) would fail.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +18,22 @@build:
  number: 0
  skip: True  # [win or py2k]
  entry_points:
    - sasview = sas.qtgui.MainWindow.MainWindow:run_sasview
